intro: Trigonostemon kwangsiensis var. viridulus, commonly known as the green-flowered trigonostemon, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive triangular leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
